intro: Cryptantha torreyana var. genuina, commonly known as the Torrey's cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, such as grasslands and slopes. It has slender stems and is often found in dry, sunny environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in arid conditions.
